March 8, 2025 - A capon (from Latin: cāpō, genitive cāpōnis) is a male chicken that has been castrated or neutered, either physically or chemically, to improve the quality of its flesh for food, and, in some countries like Spain, fattened by forced feeding.

Capons are, without doubt, the best poultry you’ll ever eat. We found one at our local grocery several years ago and have never looked back! The meat is much more tender than turkey or chicken and has delicate flavor notes not found in mass produced poultry. Most grocers can order you one, but if yours can’t this is a great solution.
